snippet: The selection of an Argentine, Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, as pope served as an emphatic salute to the growing power of Latinos across the Americas.
abstract: Surprise selection of an Argentine, Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, as the new pope shifts the gravity of the Roman Catholic Church from Europe to Latin America; choice shows the growing power of Latinos across the Americas, and may provide a strategic boost to the church in the United States.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rachel Donadio, Gaia Pianigiani and Daniel J. Wakin from Vatican City; Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome; Jennifer Medina from Los Angeles; Fernanda Santos from Phoenix; and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: The selection of an Argentine, Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, as pope served as an emphatic salute to the growing power of Latinos across the Americas.

headline.seo: New Pope Selection Shifts Church’s Center Away From Europe
headline.main: New Pope Shifts Church’s Center of Gravity Away From Europe
headline.print_headline: A New Pope, From the Americas
